reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Visually-Stunning Adaptation
reviews.reviewText: In “Frank Herbert’s Dune: The Graphic Novel Adaptation, Book 1,” Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson set out to adapt the text in a visual format as faithfully as possible, featuring art by Raúl Allén and Patricia Martín with a cover by Bill Sienkiewicz, who did the art for the Marvel Comics adaptation of David Lynch’s 1984 adaptation of “Dune.” Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson write in their preface, “We weren’t interested in doing our interpretation of ‘Dune’ or modifying the story to add our own special stamps. We wanted this to be pure ‘Dune’ – chapter for chapter, scene for scene… Because the original novel is broken into three “books,” the graphic novel will be released in three separate volumes… We kept a watchful eye on the ‘Dune’ canon that Frank Herbert laid out, and made certain that the art matched the vision he had for his incredible universe.” They succeed in faithfully adapting Herbert’s novel with the only significant change occurring near the end as a way to foreshadow events that will occur in the subsequent two volumes. Allén and Martín’s art beautifully compliments the story, with stunning colors evoking the underlying emotion and settings of each scene. Their portrayal of the sandworms of Arrakis are particularly stunning. Fans of “Dune” will find this a beautiful companion to the novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Becoming a big fan of all things DUNE
reviews.reviewText: To those who found themselves drawn into the cosmic universe of DUNE, guided by the visual enchantments of the 2021 filmic translation, this critique is your guiding star. My recollections of the previous cinematic endeavors and series are but distant mirages, shapes forming and fading in the vast desert of memory.The recent film, a luminous spectacle, gripped my senses with an unrelenting intensity. Every frame, a meticulously crafted tableau, seemed capable of assuming a cherished position upon one's walls, a captured moment of grandeur and visual poetry. As a frequent voyager through the realms of graphic novels that eschew the trappings of superhuman protagonist, I felt a compelling allure towards this medium of DUNE.This novel, sketched and inked, draws its inspiration more heavily from Herbert's original literary masterpiece, although the tones that it strikes seem, perhaps, less steeped in the brooding depths of maturity. Yet, there is an elusive charm about it, a refreshing energy that manifests in every inked line and coloured panel.This graphic rendering, therefore, deserves a place in your collection, although one must warn not to anticipate the ethereal ambience of the film. It is a beast of different colors and contours, a creature born of ink and paper rather than light and shadow. It aligns itself more closely with the sand-scoured landscapes of the book, inviting you to experience DUNE in yet another richly textured iteration. Thus, venture forth and embrace this interpretation, my fellow wanderers in the desolate yet captivating universe of DUNE.

reviews.reviewText: The drawings are near perfect! The story is very close to the books and give a different, but still great feel to the story of dune.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New to Graphic Novels - What a great first choice!
reviews.reviewText: Consumed the Dune series as a teen and this is my first revisit to Arrakis; thoroughly enjoyed it.So little time to sit down and read anymore, this graphic novel was a great way to re-aquiant myself with Arrakis without taking months to re-read the books - that was my original intent. But as I flipped through the supurbly illustrated cells, I quickly came to appreciate the beauty of Graphic Novels. The moments captured in the cells were expertly chosen, conveying the important parts of the story in a cohesive and flowing way; I have no idea how they were able to chose the right scenes from such a packed novel as Dune and tell the story so well.I will be getting the next in the series.Well done! To those involved in the making of this graphic novel, and thank you for putting me on to a new genre. I'll be exploring many more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I’m going to repeat what a lot of others have said about this. A great and faithful adaptation of the book Dune. I really enjoyed this read and the graphics are pretty cool also. The cover and pages feel great in my hand as I read this. The dust jacket is stunning (front and back) as is the image of the sandworm. I recommend this for any Dune fan to have as part of their collection. I’m so glad I have this. I love it!
No lo se x q era para regalar

reviews.reviewTitle: Frantastico! Non vedo l'ora di leggere il prossimo volume!
reviews.reviewText: ATTENZIONE: Quello che ho acquistato è in inglese, fate attenzione alla lingua!E' semplicemente fantastico: la fedele trasposizione a fumetti del primo libro della saga di Dune. Ripercorre fedelmente il libro, calandoci nelle plendide ambientazioni del mondo di Arrakis.Un must have per tutti i fan!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great interpretation of (Part 1 of) the original Dune
reviews.reviewText: This graphic novel is a great interpretation of the first part of the original Dune book. However, i wish it was stylistically more closely related to Denis Villeneuve's 2021 Dune (in more that just the DUNE title font) because i really like some of his choices such as the brave casting of Liet Kynes as a black woman. But other than that, it's great! Too bad that part 2 wont be out until Spring of 2022, though!
